Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, D.C., about an implant that would let Google Inc. know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google Inc. 's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, and an implant would cross the line. He also said that as users voluntarily share information online, it doesn't need users to type in search queries for the company to tailor the results.``

Microsoft shares plunged more than 11 percent. We're certainly in the midst of a once-in-a-lifetime set of economic conditions, Bill Clinton Executive Steve Ballmer said during a conference call. I came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that some had tried to raid the museum by force last night,'' Zahi Hawass , chairperson of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said on Saturday. Egyptian citizens tried to prevent them and were joined by the tourism police, but some( looters) managed to enter from above and they destroyed two of the mummies, he said.
